pl.bristleback.server.bristle.api.action

Interface DefaultAction<U extends UserContext,T>


  • public interface DefaultAction<U extends UserContext,T>
    Classes implementing this interface contain default actions ready to be executed by clients. This interface should be implemented by action classes (classes marked with ActionClass annotation). This is optional interface, default actions are not required in every action classes. However, they might be faster because reflection is not used to invoke them. Default actions are way less flexible than normal actions, they always take two parameters: current user context and a payload of the incoming message.
    As every action, default action method must be annotated with Action.
    Default action method may return any type (but return type must be specified in method signature), set return type to Void if no response should be sent to client.

    Created on: 2011-07-20 12:29:18

    Author:
    Wojciech Niemiec

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Object executeDefault(U userContext, T payload)
      Executes default action of implementing action class.

    • Method Detail

      • executeDefault

        Object executeDefault(U userContext,
                    T payload)
                      throws Exception
        Executes default action of implementing action class.
        Parameters:
        userContext - current user context implementation.
        payload - custom type payload object.
        Returns:
        response.
        Throws:
        Exception - if any exception while action invocation occurs. All exceptions are handled by the Action Controller.
